The payment of: 400 million to Iran was made by the Obama administration in August 2016 to resolve a long-outstanding legal claim being pursued through the Iran-United States Claims Tribunal.
The White House claimed that the payment: 1.7 billion seized in 1979 after an arms deal with the Shah of Iran was halted following the Islamic revolution.
The White House press secretary: Josh Earnest, maintained that the payment to Iran was part of the resolution of a longstanding financial dispute and denounced the assertions from some Republicans that it was a ransom for the release of four Americans.
